channel.title: CVE Feed for bfintal -- Stackable – Page Builder Gutenberg Blocks
channel.description: The latest CVEs for bfintal -- Stackable – Page Builder Gutenberg Blocks

item.title: CVE-2024-6296|2024-07-02T18:51:29.772Z -- bfintal -- stackable%20%E2%80%93%20page%20builder%20gutenberg%20blocks
item.description: The Stackable – Page Builder Gutenberg Blocks plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘data-caption’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.13.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2039|2024-04-09T18:59:27.171Z -- bfintal -- stackable%20%E2%80%93%20page%20builder%20gutenberg%20blocks
item.description: The Stackable – Page Builder Gutenberg Blocks plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Post(v2) block title tag in all versions up to, and including, 3.12.11 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-6296|2024-06-28T03:36:42.693Z -- bfintal -- stackable%20%E2%80%93%20page%20builder%20gutenberg%20blocks
item.description: The Stackable – Page Builder Gutenberg Blocks plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘data-caption’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.13.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
